summary: Email chain from April 2021 regarding logistical planning for the defense review of evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It involves scheduling FBI agents and AUSAs to be present at 500 Pearl Street, and mentions the transfer of highly confidential evidence including images from CDs and Epstein's devices.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM' and 'Maxwell'; the US Marshals are bringing her to 500 Pearl Street early for an evidence review.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk, is coordinating the evidence review schedule and logistics.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An AUSA from the Southern District of New York is managing logistics for the evidence review, expressing gratitude, and noting other AUSAs on the case may stop by.

connections.description: The AUSA is part of the prosecution team managing the evidence review for Maxwell's defense.
They are coordinating logistics for the evidence review in the Maxwell case.
The FBI agent is involved in the evidence review process related to Maxwell's case.

events.title: Evidence Review Day 1
events.description: Scheduled start of the multi-day defense review of highly confidential evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Evidence Review Day 2
events.description: Continuation of the defense evidence review.

events.title: Evidence Review Day 3
events.description: Continuation of the defense evidence review.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY (specifically the 5th Floor)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (SDNY office)
keyFacts: In April 2021, a multi-day evidence review for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense was scheduled at 500 Pearl Street, with FBI agents and AUSAs coordinating logistics.
The evidence to be reviewed included highly confidential images from CDs and from Jeffrey Epstein's devices that the defense had not yet seen.
The US Marshals were responsible for transporting Ghislaine Maxwell to the review location early in the morning.
The email chain highlights the procedural and collaborative efforts between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office in managing sensitive evidence for a high-profile case.
